key_risks: Legal and regulatory risks, including securities and patent litigation
Supply chain vulnerabilities, including semiconductor shortages and logistics challenges
Labor and ethical concerns, including unfair labor practices and employment discrimination
Intense market competition in automotive electronics and driver-assistance systems
controversies: Securities litigation (Zalvin v. Gentex Corp.) alleging inadequate disclosures
Patent infringement lawsuit settlement with Galvion
NLRB investigation into unfair labor practices and gender discrimination
Civil rights lawsuit (Helminski v. Gentex Corporation) alleging employment discrimination
social_issues: Unfair labor practices and gender discrimination allegations
governance_issues: Securities litigation highlighting governance and compliance risks
NLRB investigation into workplace culture and labor practices

sources.title: Zalvin v. Gentex Corp., 19-CV-2215 (RRM) (RML) - Casetext

sources.title: Gentex : 2024 Sustainability Report, Covering FY 2023
sources.snippet: Due to the disruptions caused by the COVID-19 pandemic in 2020, Gentex is shifting to 2021 as a more reliable baseline for evaluating performance and planning future sustainability strategies. Factors such as reduced car usage, slowed manufacturing, and widespread economic impacts made 2020 an inaccurate representation of typical operations.
